bibl.title: Bronze Statuettes of a Prince of Armenia.
in collaboration with Lyla PINCH BROCK, Egyptology at the Dawn of the Twenty-first Century. Proceedings of the Eighth International Congress of Egyptologists, Cairo, 2000. Volume 2: History, Religion
bibl.author: GOUDCHAUX, Guy Weill

bibl.note: New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Inv. 49.II.3; - Baltimore, Walters Art Gallery, Inv. 54.1330. Bronze, 64 and 62 cm. Alexandria (?), second half of the Ist century B.C. The statuettes represent Alexander Helios, son of Cleopatra VII and Antony.
GOUDCHAUX Guy Weill, Bronze Statuettes of a Prince of Armenia.

Zahi HAWASS (Ed.), in collaboration with Lyla PINCH BROCK, Egyptology at the Dawn of the Twenty-first Century. Proceedings of the Eighth International Congress of Egyptologists, Cairo, 2000. Volume 2: History, Religion (Cairo - New York, 2003) pp. 254-260, 4 figg.
